column1: Tirupati ( (listen)) is a city in Chittoor district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. The city is home to most famous and important Vaishnavite shrine of Tirumala Venkateswara Temple and other historic temples and is referred to as the "Spiritual Capital of Andhra Pradesh". It is one of the eight Swayam vyaktha kshetras dedicated to Vishnu. Tirupati is a municipal corporation and the headquarters of Tirupati (urban) mandal and Tirupati (rural) mandal and of the Tirupati revenue division. As of 2011 census
column2: it had a population of 287
column3: 035 making it the 9th most populous city in Andhra Pradesh. It is the seventh most urban agglomerated city in the state
column4: with a population of 459
column5: 985. It is the second biggest city in Rayalaseema after Kurnool. For the year 2012–13
column6: India's Ministry of Tourism named Tirupati as the "Best Heritage City". Tirupati has been selected as one of the hundred Indian cities to be developed as a smart city under Smart Cities Mission by Government of India.

column2: Tiru means the sacred or Goddess Lakshmi and pathi means abode or husband.

column1: Tirupati (Tirumala) is referred to as Pushpa-mandapa in Acharya-Hridayam (13th century).

column2: during Treta Yugam
column3: Rama resided here along with Sita and Lakshmana on his return from Lankapuri.As per the purana
column4: a loan of one crore and 11.4 million gold coins was sought by Balaji from Kubera for his marriage with Padmavathi. To pay back the loan
column5: devotees from all over India visit the temple and donate money.

column1: The city became great Vaishnava centre during the time of Ramanujacharya in 11th century
column2: from where Srivaishnavism spread to other parts of Andhra Desa. Srikurmam Temple in Srikakulam district of Andhra Pradesh bears the inscription saying Tirupati Srivaishnavula Raksha. Tirupati survived the Muslim invasions. During the early 1300s Muslim invasion of South India
column3: the deity of Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple
column4: Srirangam was brought to Tirupati for safekeeping. The temple town for most of the medieval era part of Vijayanagara Empire until the 17th century and its rulers contributed considerable resources and wealth notable by Krishna Deva Raya and Achyuta Deva Raya
column5: Sadasiva Raya and Tirumala Deva Raya.

column1: The city has many historical temples including the Venkateswara Temple which bears 1150 inscriptions in Sanskrit
column2: Tamil
column3: Telugu and Kannada languages. Out of 1150 inscriptions 236 belong to Pallava
column4: Chola and Pandya dynasties
column6: 251 belonged to Achyuta Deva Raya period
column7: 130 belonged to Sadasiva Raya period and another 135 originated in Aravidu dynasty. which specify the contributions of the Pallava Kingdom around the 9th century AD
column8: Chola Kingdom around the 10th century AD and the Vijayanagara Empire in the 14th century AD.

column2: Sri Tallapaka Annamacharya sung many songs in praise of the holy town in Telugu.

column1: He compared it to be divine
column2: including the rocks
column3: streams
column4: trees
column6: and adds that it is heaven on the earth. One example of such a song is:

column2: in all its right
column3: is heaven. Its powers are indescribable. The Vedas have taken the form of rocks and appeared on Tirumala. Holiness has taken the form of water and is flowing as streams on Tirumala. Its holy peaks are Brahmaloka and other lokas. Srinivasa lives on Seshadri.

column1: There was no human settlement at Lower Tirupati until 1500. With the growing importance of Upper Tirupati
column2: a village formed at the present-day Kapilatheertham Road area and was named "kotturu". It was later shifted to the vicinity of Govindarajaswamy Temple which was consecrated around the year 1130 CE. Later the village grew into its present-day form around Govindaraja Swamy Temple which is now the heart of the city. It has now gained a lot of popularity as a tourism place.
Tirumala Venkateswara Temple was handed over to Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams by the TTD Act of 1932. In 2006
column3: Tirupati Urban Development Authority (TUDA) and TTD together conducted "Tirupati Utsavam" which focused on the history of development of Tirupati town
column4: kings who visited Tirumala and their contribution for development of the temple. The fourth World Telugu Conference
column5: a conference for furtherance of Telugu language
column6: was conducted at Tirupati during December 2012 for three days. In January 2017
column7: the 104th Indian Science Congress (ISCA) meeting was held in Tirupati.

column1: Tirupati is located at 13.65°N 79.42°E﻿ / 13.65; 79.42 in the Chittoor District of South Indian State of Andhra Pradesh. It lies at the foot of Seshachalam Hills of Eastern Ghats which were formed during Precambrian era. One of its suburbs
column2: Tirumala
column3: which is the home to Sri Venkateswara Temple
column4: is also located within the hills. Tirupati Urban agglomeration includes Tirupati (City) and census towns Akkarampalle
column6: Cherlopalle
column13: Tirupati (NMA).Tirupati is surrounded by Srikalahasti towards the east
column15: Poothalapattu towards the west and the Seshachalam hills towards the north. Swarnamukhi River originates in Chandragiri Hills and passes through the Tirupati City before reaching Srikalahasti in the east.

column1: At 12 km point on the Tirupati – Tirumala ghat road
column2: there is a major discontinuity of stratigraphic significance that represents a period of remarkable serenity in the geological history of the Earth. This is referred to as Eparchaean Unconformity. This unconformity separates the Proterozoic Nagari Quartzite and the Archean granite representing a time gap of 800 Ma. In 2001
column3: the Geological Survey of India (GSI) declared the Eparchaean Unconfirmity to be one of the 26 "Geological Monuments of India".

column2: a natural arch and a distinctive geological feature
column3: is located in the Tirumala Hills at a distance of 1 km from Tirumala Venkateswara Temple. The Arch measures 8 metres in width and 3 metres in height and is eroded from quartzite of Cuddapah Supergroup of Middle to Upper Proterozoic (1600 to 570 Ma) by weathering agents like water and wind.

column1: Sri Venkateswara National Park is a national park and biosphere reserve which is part of Seshachalam Hills. The total area of the park is 353 km2. The park is home for about 1
column2: 500 vascular plant species belonging to 174 families. Some of the rare and endemic plant species like red sanders
column3: Shorea talura
column4: Shorea thumburggaia
column6: sandalwood
column8: and Psilotum nudum occur in this region. Cycas beddomei
column9: a species of cycad in the genus Cycas
column10: is found only in the Tirumala Hills.

column1: About 178 species of birds from this national park have been identified which includes the globally threatened yellow-throated bulbul
column2: grey-fronted green pigeon
column3: critically endangered Oriental white-backed vulture
column4: large hawk-cuckoo
column6: yellow-browed bulbul
column7: Indian scimitar-babbler and Loten's sunbird. Among predators the leopard is quite common
column8: along with the wild dog. Among reptiles
column9: the most interesting species is the gliding lizard
column10: found in some deep forested valleys. Another important reptile of this national park is the golden gecko.

column2: Tirupati Zoo or Sri Venkateswara Zoological Park is a zoo located at Tirupati and is Asia's second largest zoo
column3: with an area of 5500 acres. It is built on the concept of Hindu mythology. It exhibits only animals that are mentioned in the ancient epics like Ramayana
column4: Mahabharatha
column5: and Panchatantra. The enclosures are named based on Indian mythology. It hosts a wide range of animals such as deer
column6: monkeys

column1: Sri Venkateswara Gosamrakshana shala is a home for cattle received as a donation (Godanam). It was established in 1956 by TTD and renamed to S.V. Gosamrakshana Shala in 2004. It is located at Chandragiri Road
column2: Tirupati. It is maintained by Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams based on the funds received under the Sri Venkateswara Gosamrakshana Shala Trust. Activities of the trust include providing a good environment
column3: management
column4: and feeding for the cattle. The milk and its products produced here are used by TTD for daily rituals at Sri Venkateswara Temple and other TTD temples.

column1: Tirupati has a tropical wet and dry climate
column2: designated Aw under the Köppen climate classification. In winter the minimum temperatures are between 18 and 20 degrees Celsius. Usually summer lasts from March to June
column3: with the advent of rainy season in July
column4: followed by winter which lasts until the end of February. The city experiences heavy rainfall in November during the northeast monsoon season. The highest rainfall in 24 hours was on 16 November 2015 with 219 mm. Cyclones commonly hit the Coast of Nellore
column5: which brings heavy showers to the city.

column2: Ugadi
column3: Krishna Janmashtami
column4: Maha Shivaratri
column6: Deepavali
column8: Kartik Poornima etc. Srivari Brahmotsavam is a nine-day event

column11: the processional deity Malayappa of Venkateswara Temple
column12: along with his consorts Sridevi and Bhudevi
column13: is taken in a procession in four mada streets around the temple on different Vahanams. Tirupati also celebrates a carnival named as Tirupati Ganga Jatara
column14: held during second week of May every year. This is a week long festival where Goddess Gangamma (Grama Devatha) is worshiped. The tank behind the temple of Padmavathi Temple
column16: where Chakra Snanam will be held on last day of Annual Padmavathi Brahmotsavams (Panchami Teertham). It will witness lakhs of Devotees taking a dip in the holy waters.Vaikunta Ekadasi
column17: the day on which it is believed that Vaikunta Dwarams will be opened and the most important Vasihnavite festival
column18: is celebrated in Tirumala and Tirupati with grandeur. Rathasapthami is another festival
column20: when Lord Venkateswara's processional deity (Malayappa) is taken in a procession around the temple on seven different vahanas from early morning to late night.Sri Krishna janmastami also known as Gokulashtami is celebrated with great fervor at Tirupati. The Lotus Temple belonging to International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON) will be illuminated with lamps and paintings displaying themes from Srimad Bhagavatham. The celebrations include offering prayers to Sri Krishna
column23: Geetha Parayanam etc. On this day 'Gokulashtami Asthanam' will be held at Tirumala Venkateswara Temple. TTD will also celebrate the janmastami at Sri Venkateswara Gosamrakshana Shala where prayers will be offered to cows
column24: horses and elephants. The Maha Shivaratri and Kartik Poornima are the most auspicious occasions celebrated in Kapila Theertham.

column1: Tirupati is world-famous for Tirupati Laddu. It is the prasadam at Venkateswara Temple
column2: Tirumala. Tirupati Laddu had got Geographical indication tag which entitles only Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams to make or sell it.
crafts and architecture ===

column1: Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams established Sri Venkateswara Museum
column2: one at Tirumala and the other at Tirupati. It has a wonderful collection of Tirupati temple architecture and historical artefacts
column3: such as ancient weaponry
column4: pooja items and idols. It has a comprehensive photo gallery that gives a unique insight into the Tirupati region's culture and traditions. It also boasts a meditation centre. In 1988–89 Archaeological Survey of India had established an Archaeological Museum in the Chandragiri fort at Chandragiri. It exhibits rich collection of stone and metal sculptures of Hindu gods and other cultural vestiges retrieved from other historical places like Gudimallam
column5: Gandikota and Yaganti. It also includes galleries for medieval weaponry swords and daggers
column6: coins and paper documents.

column1: Tirupati Assembly constituency is one of the 175 assembly constituencies of Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly
column2: India. Tirupati is part of Tirupati (Lok Sabha constituency). Balli Durga Prasad Rao of YSR Congress Party is the sitting Member of Parliament for Tirupati (Lok Sabha constituency) and Bhumana Karunakara Reddy of YSR Congress Party is the sitting Member of Legislative Assembly for Tirupati (Assembly constituency).

column1: Tirupati Municipal Corporation (TMC) oversees the administration of the city. Tirupati was constituted as a municipality on 1 April 1886; it was upgraded to a second grade municipality on 1 October 1962
column2: to a first grade municipality on 12 December 1965
column3: to special grade municipality on 13 February 1970
column4: and to selection grade municipality on 7 October 1998. Tirupati Municipality was upgraded to a municipal corporation on 2 March 2007. The area of the municipal corporation at the time of formation was 16.59 square kilometres (6.41 sq mi). While
column5: at present the area of the city is 27.44 square kilometres (10.59 sq mi).Tirupati Urban Development Authority (TUDA) is the urban planning authority. It was constituted in the year 1981
column6: with Tirupati town and 89 villages under its jurisdiction. In 2008
column8: Puttur and 69 surrounding villages. At present TUDA covers an area of 1

column1: Tirupati has the status of Urban Police District; it has 25 police stations. Tirupati temple was deployed with 100 Octopus (Organisation For Counter Terrorist Operations)  commandos to look over its security. This was formed by Government of Andhra Pradesh in the year 2012. The elite commando force has been specially trained for in house intervention
column2: hostage rescue and Israeli combat technique Krav Maga.At Alipiri
column3: security zone was established to screen vehicles and pilgrims entering Tirumala
column4: to safeguard the hills from terrorists and anti-social elements. To assure more safety in Tirumala-Tirupati
column5: the government of Andhra Pradesh started a project called "Safe City-Tirupati": the Tirupati temple and the city will be placed under 24*7 CCTV surveillance with 3000 CCTV cameras
column6: monitored from a command-and-control centre. Baggage scanners and Explosive detectors are installed at several places.

column1: Electricity to the city is distributed by Andhra Pradesh Southern Power Distribution Company Limited (APSPDCL)
column2: headquartered at Tirupati. The city mostly depends on groundwater for its needs
column3: though it also gets water from Telugu Ganga canal and Kalyani dam. There are five dams in the vicinity: Kalyani Dam
column4: Papavinasanam Dam
column6: Pasupudara Dam
column8: Akasa Ganga. all in the Tirumala Hill ranges. Of these dams Papavinasanam
column12: and Akasa Ganga completely cater the water needs of Tirumala and Venkateswara Temple while 49% of Kalyani Dam water is being supplied to Tirumala and remaining water will be supplied to Tirupati.Tirupati falls under the Tirupati Telecom District of the Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited. BSNL is planning to establish 27 Wi-Fi hotspots in the city. The city also had a Regional Passport Seva Kendra(PSK). PSK-Tirupati will cover Prakasam
column16: Kurnool and Anantapur districts of Andhra Pradesh and will come under Visakhapatnam Passport Office.The city ranked 6th in India among the 200 cities that competed during Swachh Survekshan – 2018 conducted by Ministry of Urban Development
column18: and the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) of India. According to the National Urban Sanitation Policy
column19: the city was ranked 117th in the country in 2009–10
column20: with a total of 39.363 points. As a part of 'Swachh Tirupati'
column21: Tirupati Municipal Corporation has started household waste segregation programme. As of May 2015
column22: 150 Tonnes of waste is being collected per day from households within the municipal limits. The city is the 11th most cleanliest city with 66 points in the cleanliness scorecard published by Union Tourism Ministry of India.

column1: Tirupati is a medical hub with major hospitals situated in its vicinity. Many of these are either run under State government or run/funded by Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD).
Sri Venkateswara Ramnarain Ruia Government General Hospital is one of the largest in the state of Andhra Pradesh
column2: and the main government hospital for the Rayalaseema region. It is started in the year 1962 with a donation of Rs.5 lakhs from Sri Radha Krishna N. Ruia and 15 lakhs from Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams. At present it has 750 beds. Sri Venkateswara Institute of Medical Sciences (SVIMS) is another major medical institute
column3: founded in 1986.Balaji Institute of Surgery
column4: Research and Rehabilitation(BIRRD) for the Disabled has 250 beds; it was established in 1985 by TTD to treat patients suffering from polio myelitis
column6: congenital anomalies
column8: and the orthopaedically handicapped. A non-profit organisation
column9: it is run with funds from Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams and donations from the public. Government Maternity Hospital (GMH) in Tirupati is the largest maternity hospital in the state of Andhra pradesh in terms of number of deliveries. Established 50 years ago
column10: GMH is thronged by Pregnant woman from Chittoor
column13: Anantapur districts of Andhra Pradesh and few areas of Tamil Nadu. GMH was named "best hospital" under the "sterilization and institutional deliveries category" from the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare for the year 2013. Aswini Hospital in Tirumala is a general hospital in Tirumala maintained by TTD.

column1: Tourism is the major industry in Tirupati.The entire economy directly or indirectly depends on Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD). TTD is headquartered at Tirupati. Established in 1932
column2: TTD is an independent trust which manages Tirumala Venkateswara Temple and other temples in Tirupati and all over the world. It is also involved in several social activities. As Tirupati is a major religious tourist destination
column3: the hospitality industry is also a major industry which includes many 3 star hotels and lodges.Andhra Pradesh Southern Power Distribution Company Limited (APSPDCL) is also headquartered at Tirupati. Gandhi Road
column4: Prakasam Road
column6: AIR Bypass Road are highly commercial areas in the City. Major brands of Automobile
column9: Electrical and Electronic companies have their outlets in Tirupati.APIIC Industrial Park is located at Gajulamandyam
column10: Renigunta. Industries like Sri Venkateswara Cooperative Sugar Factory Limited
column11: AshwiniBio Pharma Ltd and others are situated in this park. Amara Raja factory is located at Karakambadi
column12: Renigunta. Lanco cement factory is located at Eerpedu mandal. The majority of the city residents are employed under TTD. Zoho
column13: an Indian software development company has an office in Renigunta and has been operating from this office since 2018.

column1: Sri Venkateshwara Mobile and Electronics Manufacturing Hub is a dedicated mobile handset and electronics manufacturing facility located at Tirupati. The Hub is spread over 122 acres (49 ha) Acres out of which Celkon is established in 20 acres (8.1 ha)  acres
column2: Micromax in 15 acres (6.1 ha)  acres
column3: Karbonn in 15.28 acres (6.18 ha)  acres and Lava in 20 acres (8.1 ha)  acres with a total investment of Rupees 2000 crores. Dixon Technologies has a manufacturing unit in this hub
column4: where they are producing Smart TVs for Xiaomi.

column1: Tourism sector is of great importance to the city. It is because of the presence of Tirumala Venkateswara Temple and a number of other temples in and around the city. It attracts large number of tourists which helps the tourism department of the state in generating revenue. Tirumala is said to be one of the most visited religious sites on earth
column2: and Tirupati Temple is currently a Guinness World Record holder for most visited temple in the world. Tourism comprises a large portion of the Tirupati economy.

column1: Tirumala Venkateswara Temple is the most notable temple for being the world's richest Vaishnavite temple of Lord Venkateswara. Beside Venkateswara Temple
column2: the city is known for many other ancient temples
column3: such as Padmavathi Temple at Tiruchanur
column4: Govindaraja Temple
column6: Thathayyagunta Gangamma Temple of Goddess Gangamma is the Gramadevata of Tirupati

column2: there are other tourist destinations in and around the city. Chandragiri Fort is a historical fort

column4: Sri Venkateswara Zoological Park in Tirupati is the largest zoo park in Asia
column5: which covers an area of 5532 acres. Tirupati also hosts a Regional Science centre. A Space Exposition Hall which has a digital Planetarium
column6: first of its kind in Andhra Pradesh and an Innovation Space are added to this centre now.

column1: The city is well connected to major cities through national and state highways. The National highways passing through Tirupati are
column2: National Highway 71 which connects Madanapalle and Nayudupeta
column3: National Highway 140 connecting Tirupati with Puthalapattu. Within Tirupati Urban Development Authority Limits

NH 716 connects Renigunta part of Tirupati to Chennai and Muddanur (via Kadapa and Rajampet).NH 565 on the other hand connects NH 71 to NH 65. it starts from Yerpedu area of Tirupati and ends at Nakrekal in Nalgonda district. Constructed one in 1944 and the other in 1974
column6: asphalt Ghat Roads between Tirupati and Tirumala. There is a total of 294.47 km of Roads within the Tirupati Municipal Corporation Limits.

column1: APSRTC is the state owned transport service
column2: which operates buses to various destinations from Tirupati bus station complex. The bus station comprises three mini bus stations to various destinations
column3: such as Srinivasa bus station for west-bound destinations
column4: Sri Hari bus station for east bound destinations and Yedukondalu bus station is utilised for bus services to Tirumala. Balaji Link bus station at Alipiri is also used for bus services to Tirumala. Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams runs free buses from the railway station and central bus stand to Alipiri for pilgrims. The buses to Tirumala are known as Sapthagiri Express.Tirupati is in close proximity with the states of Karnataka and Tamil Nadu. Hence
column5: direct buses from Tirumala to Chennai
column6: Bengaluru
column9: Vellore  are run by APSRTC Sapthagiri Express. KSRTC
column10: TNSTC and SETC also operates their services to Lower Tirupati. There are also private transport which operate in the city.

column1: There are two footpaths from Tirupati to Tirumala. These paths are called Sopanamargas and are mostly used by pilgrims. The first (and oldest) path starts from Alipiri and has 3550 steps
column2: totalling 11 km. At Alipiri there is a temple dedicated to Lord Venkateswara called Padalamandapam. There are four Gopurams (temple towers) along the way. The other path
column3: called Sri Vari Mettu starts from Srinivasa Mangapuram and is 6 km long. Both paths are completely roofed and pass through seven hills (part of Seshachalam Hills).

column1: Tirupati Main is classified as an A1 station in the Guntakal railway division of South Central Railway zone. Tirupati West Halt and Tiruchanur are the satellite stations
column2: used for decongesting rail traffic at the main station. In addition to these
column3: Tirupati also has Chandragiri
column4: Yerpedu and Renigunta Junction Railway stations to serve the needs of the people of the city.

column1: Sri Venkateswara Airport is located 15 km from the city centre and has regular flights to Coimbatore
column2: Hyderabad
column3: Kolkata
column4: Mumbai
column6: Vijayawada and Visakhapatnam. The closest international airport is Chennai International Airport which is 130 km (81 mi) from Tirupati. Tirupati Airport is being upgraded to an international airport. The new terminal was inaugurated on 22 October 2015 by Prime Minister of India

Seven diploma courses are offered in subjects such as temple architecture

column17: Tirupati is the first culinary institute in India established by Ministry of Tourism (India).The city has Indian Institutes of Science Education and Research (IISER) and Indian institute of technology (IIT) which were allotted by Government of India to the state of Andhra Pradesh. There is a law college named Sri Venkateswara College of Law.

column1: The National Atmospheric Research Laboratory (NARL) is an autonomous research institute funded by the Department of Space of the Government of India. NARL is engaged in fundamental and applied research in the field of atmospheric sciences. It is around 30 km from Tirupati.

column2: Tirupati is selected for establishment of Multidisciplinary Research Units (MRUs) and Model Rural Health Research Units (MRHRU) by the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR).

column1: Sri Venkateswara Institute of Medical Sciences (SVIMS)
column2: Tirupati is selected for establishment of college level Viral Diagnostic Research Labs

column1: A sub-centre for All India Coordinated Research Project (AICRP) on the groundnut is established at the Regional Agricultural Research Station (RARS)
column2: Tirupati to conduct research activities on new high. The research will help to meet the needs of the country's 100 arid districts which receive less than 500 mm rainfall. RARS has so far developed 12 groundnut varieties.

column1: A research centre for indigenous cows was established by TTD at its dairy farm named Sri Venkateswara Gosamrakshanashala. The purpose of the centre is to protect the cows and also to share the rare breeds among similar organisations. The Gosamrakshanashala already had distinctive high-worth breeds like Ongole
column2: while it is also trying to gather Sahiwal breed of cows from Punjab
column3: Gir cows of Gujarat to the Centre
column4: Tharparker and Kankrej cows from Karnataka.
